intro: Selaginella conferta, commonly known as the common spikemoss, is a member of the Selaginellaceae family and is native to various regions in Africa, including South Africa. It is a terrestrial, evergreen plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. The plant has a distinctive appearance with spirally arranged leaves that form dense, compact clusters. Its reproductive structures, including strobila, are borne on specialized stems and contain the spores necessary for propagation. Selaginella conferta is known for its ability to survive in nutrient-poor soils and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
